title: Subcellular Mapping of Thallium (Tl) Delivered by Prussian Blue Nanoparticles in Lung Cancer Cells
content: Thallium-201 (201Tl) releases around 37 Auger and other secondary electrons per decay [1] and shows significant radiotoxic effect in cancer cells in a form of Tl+ ions [2]. The efficient chelation of 201Tl remains a challenge, leading to a lack of suitable chelators for targeted delivery of this radioisotope. Prussian blue can efficiently bind thallium and is an FDA-approved antidote for thallium poisoning. In this study, we aimed to compare the kinetics and subcellular localisation of two different types of Prussian blue nanoparticles (PBNPs) coated with citric acid (caPBNPs) or chitosan (chPBNPs) and incubated with thallium (I) chloride or radiolabelled with 201Tl to develop a potential radiopharmaceutic for cancer therapy.
